website_summaries.verdict: This is Celestron's most advanced telescope to date and enables you to quickly find planets and other objects with its built-in database.
pros: Fully automated telescope with database of over 40,000 celestial objects
Easy to set up and align the telescope
Sturdy tripod is easy to assemble and disassemble
cons: This telescope may be too expensive for some

customer_reviews.title: Wont last , motor failed..
customer_reviews.text: Barely had it 6 months now.. and the up and down motor went out last night):-[.. $1000+Telescope didnt last a year, let alone through less than a dozen nights out ..so disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: CBS27

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy from amazon. UPS will destroy the box ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy from amazon. UPS will destroy the box by the time it gets to you and it will arrive out of focus. Everything was fuzzy. I drove hours out into the middle of nowhere to get away from light pollution and everything was still fuzzy. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Be aware before buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy from Focus Camera LLC through Amazon. The telescope looks like used and has some marks and missing parts. When I consulted the seller, he simply washes his hands referring me to Celestron. Very bad. Don't belive in their creed “Our customers are our investment. "Treat every customer as if they sign your paycheck...because they do." Ja ja ja.
customer_reviews.author: R. AGUIRRE

customer_reviews.title: Old reliable
customer_reviews.text: This was my first big scope expenditure. I started with your run-of-the-mill highly disappointing 60mm big box store 1 million power refractor telescope and I eventually graduated to small reflectors and dobs. All I can tell you is that this is the scope that I use more often than any other scope (and I have an insane collection). Mind you, I have invested significantly in this scope since I first purchased it 2014 but even in its stock form it still amazing. The price is basically the same since 2014 and this scope is by far the best bang-to-buck in amateur astronomy. It has some shortcomings rest assured but if you have the money and patience do not look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Manhattan

customer_reviews.title: Do not expect to find objects easily.
customer_reviews.text: I spent weeks looking for the best beginner’s telescope I could afford. I gave up after trying the alignment process for almost 2 hours. The telescope was quickly telling me that my alignment was successful, but when I would command it to return to the easy known star (Betelgeuse), it would be a far amount off. The telescope did not accurately align with any clearly visible objects. I spent over a thousand bucks to not need to do this, so I repackaged it and sent it back. I read all of the instructions, and am pretty tech savvy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Leppert

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed to Tears
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built, but Quality of lenses are inferior to the $199 Gskyer that I returned to buy this one for over $1,199. Programmed it to city and state and it couldn't find even the moon. The Celestron Power Tank battery caused fine tuning to be impossible. Extension cord worked well. Tripod is excellent quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Telescope!
customer_reviews.text: it really one of the fantastic telescopes ever owned. I used it around 5 times before I write this review. first time, I needed to watch some youtube videos to understand how to calibrate it. I faced some problems to coordinate it using auto two stars method at the city but using three bright stars method was really helpful. Now, I can calibrate it within less than 3 minutes!! I bought the pads to reduce valibration, power tank, adapter and celestron eyepieces and filters set all for around 270 $. I watched the moon, saturn and jupiter and their moons, venus and stars.
customer_reviews.author: MOHAMMED

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope, but not great if you want to take photos with it.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great telescope. I was hoping to take pics with it, even bought the Celestron cell phone adapter and a DSLR attachment. With the camera attached it doesn't have a full range of motion because the camera hits the base for things high in the sky. But even when attached, that single arm is super sensitive to vibration, you basically cannot touch the scope or the camera attached without shaking it. Had I known this, I would have put the $1500 (after all the accessories) into something more photo friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Rak

customer_reviews.title: Great for intermediate astrophotography
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is amazing for the price. If your wanting to do astro photography with it, I would recommend getting a better mount and not something that requires a wedge. The wedge is a poor alternative. I mean it works but it takes alot to make it work. I got good shot of orion, stacked the images and processed and stretched the image through photoshop and got my finished result. Also got some photos of the moon, they were alright. But totally recommend this scope if you just getting into observing and astrophotography :)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Colton

customer_reviews.title: Good Telescope but not so good computer
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is good if you are en expert but not so good if you are a beginner. I am a beginner and was trusting on the computer to move the telescope once it was aligned. The computer puts you to an approximate direction and from there you are on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Pranav Kumar Verma

customer_reviews.title: Not for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful telescope, but too hard for me to use. Focus was tricky and it was difficult find stars to use at my location. When I did get focused it was wonderful. Amazon allowed me to return,. I used for 12 volt power one of these sold by Amazon, wow it was/is great!! TalentCell Rechargeable 12V 6000mAh/5V 12000mAh DC Output Lithium Ion Battery Pack
customer_reviews.author: BGeorge

customer_reviews.title: Sky align didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we tried dozens of times, followed directions, watched videos and couldn’t get the sky align to work. We couldn’t view anything other than the moon which was visible with a toy telescope. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Dr Jack's Night Out...
customer_reviews.text: I've had a C8 for almost 45 years, but the new 8" NexStar is super. The technology allows one to do many astronomical things with ease including photography. The knock on NexStars is that they slew "loud" is absurd and the movement from wind or moving in general is minimal. C'mon, we're not standing in the dome at Palomar measuring parallaxes nor are we tracking satellites! It is just "We have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night." NexStar 8 implements that sentiment very well. The AC adapter is a must, however, because any battery set-up drains too fast for sustained viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Dr John E Vazzana PhD

customer_reviews.title: I had trouble with the motor being smooth as you moved the telescope up and down.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the product, the Telescope, It was a little hard to get it to accept the 3 stars to get it working, the telescope when it was working was great. I only used it 4 times because of the overcast skies and the smoke from all of the wild fires but the reason I had to return it was because as you slew down it wasn't smooth it jerked and this is unacceptable when trying to locate stars. Also the sighting in scope was not smooth and it would jump past where you were trying to sight it in, it was kind of hard to get a good alignment with the telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J.

customer_reviews.title: Weak Gears - Returned
customer_reviews.text: While setting up the scope, even when I balanced the OTA on the fork, the weight of the tube caused shift in position. Weak clutch. Sent back for refund
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Seeing the stars  and planets
customer_reviews.text: Well made and functions out of the box. Only issue is the star track setup is annoying - should be easier. Must have an external battery or ac - drains quickly
customer_reviews.author: michael T

customer_reviews.title: It's all good to me
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully clear, excellent tracking, a novice like me can locate planets and lots of heavenly bodies with ease!!!! Don't be fooled by its little pudgy picture, the thing is heavy. But the best aspect of this Celestron is it'still TECH SUPPORT. They were wonderful. Setting up this telescope should have been way more difficult. Tyler, Slay!!
customer_reviews.author: Maui2soon

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre images
customer_reviews.text: Did not think highly of this scope. Images were mediocre at best. Try a Dobson, bigger aperture, same price.
customer_reviews.author: toddisit

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck. Excellent Telescope.
customer_reviews.text: Big, heavy, expensive, exactly what you want in a quality Telescope. Love it. Does exactly what it says it will do. Planning our holiday this year around our telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Trosty

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of having it.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea, but it's more difficult to use than I'd hoped. The sighting reticle could be much better. The scope itself is awesome. I don't know why (with what is now the relatively cheap option of using GPS) this wasn't built into the scope. The find 3 bright objects thing, even after you've told it where you are on the planet (which out to tell it the altitude) and what time of day it is where you are seems superfluous; and it is cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyB

customer_reviews.title: One Stop Shop
customer_reviews.text: This is the telescope for the beginner to advanced amateur astronomer. You have the telescope plus the computerized mount in one setup. It’s a fun telescope and very easy to use. And it’s fairly powerful. Good choice for starting out in astronomy or astrophotography.
customer_reviews.author: Chad K

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: Best Mothers day gift ever!! I highly recommend a pelican briefcase for this telescope. Fits my eyepieces too. Perfect time to view the beautiful night sky!
customer_reviews.author: Frescal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome telescope !!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the 8" with 2" eyepieces and Barlow it's really money you won't regret purchasing. Any and all shortcomings you hear about, have a piece of hardware out there or software that will alleviate any issues you may have. Do your homework before you purchase any stuff for it, as you might end up purchasing an older piece of equipment Use FB forums to ask questions.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope, don't buy the dongle
customer_reviews.text: Telescope is great, but don't get the wireless accessory. The dongle is a paperweight. Telescope is really nice, though. The controls could be better. Celestron needs to work on their user experience and electronic engineering.
customer_reviews.author: F K.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Telescope. Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is an Amazing Telescope! I’ve owned Celestron telescopes in the past so I’m familiar with their quality and service. Its portability and features will allow me to “Grab and Go” for wonderful nights of star gazing all the faint fuzzies and planets!
customer_reviews.author: 4StarGeneralRelativity

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope
customer_reviews.text: Don't wait just get it This has enriched my life
customer_reviews.author: scullydavidson

customer_reviews.title: A great instrument for beginners or if you want to upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This instrument in conjunction with the 2" optics makes a great way to begin in Astronomy or astrophotography. Easy to align using the hand control or the Celestron Skyportal software or app. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Strider

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope!
customer_reviews.text: Don't go with a smaller diameter telescope if you really want to see celestial objects. This telescope is great.
customer_reviews.author: CManW

customer_reviews.title: I home school and this is great I do not live in a place that has ...
customer_reviews.text: I home school and this is great I do not live in a place that has a calm atmosphere the Caribbean is anything but that the first time seeing a nebula and Saturn WOW
customer_reviews.author: Eric A.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap attachments.
customer_reviews.text: Great telescope but comes with minimal attachments you have to replace and spend a lot more money to get a quality image.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Opens up the universe.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. Its strong enough to see the rings on Saturn, Jupiter, Venus and much much more. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: michele Dehaan

customer_reviews.title: Used Celestron Nexstar 8SE
customer_reviews.text: This supplier was very accurate in their description of the used telescope that I bought for them and I'm very happy with my purchase and recommend purchasing other products from them.
customer_reviews.author: JPB

customer_reviews.title: great scope, but the placement of the keypad thing ...
customer_reviews.text: great scope, but the placement of the keypad thing is very poor.. it never stays on there and is hard to get on at all anyways... i ended up taking it off and using the aux port on top of the tripod
customer_reviews.author: Bernie B

customer_reviews.title: great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: easy set up , crisp views. i recomend getting the car adapter i got the ac adapter then realized where was i going to plug this into unless i have a battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Izquierdo

customer_reviews.title: Great device. With T ring
customer_reviews.text: Great device. With T ring, camera (modified DSLR), photo stacker, photoshop, T ring, Camera adapter, I could take picture of deep sky objects (15-30 sec per one photo). I use ISO 800 - 3200 without autoguider/polar alignment/wedge as it takes so much time to prepare because I change location to take photo often.
customer_reviews.author: Yasuhiro Shioda

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband with the iPhone attachment to take pictures. Great for the amateur gazer.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Randall

customer_reviews.title: Just not good
customer_reviews.text: I actually like the product however the first shipment the telescope was broken the second shipment they sent the wrong telescope the third shipment right telescope and worked however had the same parts no manual no leveling bubble and no star pointer
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with my first motorized, computerized telescope. Very impressed with the views of Saturn and Jupiter. Galaxies and nebulae are less impressive, but at least I can say I've seen some through my telescope.
customer_reviews.author: eldredn

customer_reviews.title: Hope you live where it is clear.
customer_reviews.text: Seems hard to get stars to align in scope with computer program. When dialed in the viewing is phenomenal. Get some type of extension on the tube to avoid condensation if you live in a moist climate.
customer_reviews.author: John Crandell

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Only another thousand dollars for accessories and it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only another thousand dollars for accessories and it will be fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: LHR

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope, worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great telescope with great views of the planets and the moon. After a lot of research, I found this to be the best scope you could get for your money, that you'd still be able and willing to move in and out of the house. Anything heavier, and I may not be willing to take it out for only a few minutes of usage. I have never gotten the auto locate to work for me, despite calls to support. I didn't appreciate the locate and focus help with the laser sight until I tried a much cheaper telescope. Overall a great scope.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Loved and loss.... What do I do???
customer_reviews.text: Love the NexStar 8SE!!!!!! Three accessories did not come.....my husband is so sad....must now use eight batteries.....What??! ...a $1200 telescope and must use multiple AA batteries all day and night to attempt to enjoy it. Ugh!!! Where do I go next????
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Best Telescope Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This review is by my 13-year old son who has owned two other telescopes before this one. "The Celestron Nexstar 8SE is the best telescope out there. I've had 3 telescopes in my life but this is the best. It's not for beginners - you really need some telescope experience. Overall: It is a very good scope."
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 8se
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful telescope. Has a learning curve but not too bad. It's amazing how you can see stars that don't appear to be there. I'll post more as I learn and use this Telescope more. I think this is a excellent starter telescope if you take the time to learn how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: C318cuin

customer_reviews.title: A great telescope.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and set up, then tear down and move back inside after you're done viewing the sky. Computerized data base is easy to program and use. A high quality telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gift for new stargazer fans
customer_reviews.text: The telescope was easy to assemble. The whole kit is very high quality and has excellent features for a new stargazing fan on the Big Island of Hawaii.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Alley-Zarkades

customer_reviews.title: Pic from iPhone.
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty happy with using the telescope. I managed to take a decent photo in terrible lighting conditions with an iPhone. The picture doesn’t give the actual visual any justice. I haven’t had time to drive out to an area with lower light pollution but I imagine it would be even better.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great Telescope
customer_reviews.text: We have assembled it on the island of Kauai, and have done initial calibrations. We have to wait for clear skies before we start sky gazing.
customer_reviews.author: Suresh Hathiwala

customer_reviews.title: I can see the rings on Saturn from central Texas ...
customer_reviews.text: I can see the rings on Saturn from central Texas and my guest all have can't believe how clear it is! very sensitive to vibrations so you need a cushioning pad.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Y.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for elderly beginner
customer_reviews.text: Nice, would like to have real dark sky location to check it out
customer_reviews.author: Loyd Braffett

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and a great entry scope/mount
customer_reviews.text: I took many great pictures and saw several objects in the middle of downtown Phoenix, AZ (The whole sky is orange and you can barely find Polaris). great scope and mount.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: My expected gift
customer_reviews.text: At last I bought this telescope. I really enjoy the experience to use this celestron Nexstar to view the nightsky. Excellent telescope for amateurs like me.
customer_reviews.author: JOEL FEBUS

customer_reviews.title: NexStar 8 SE - Best Choice for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a NexStar 8 SE. It arrived in about 48 hours after order. It was easy to setup. I performed an initial alignment without any problems. This is my second telescope. I spent several weeks researching my selection and after reading several reviews, I decided to select this telescope. My previous telescope was a NexStar 4 SE and I really enjoyed using it. I will update this review after a couple of months of using the new telescope. Along with this purchase I also bought the AC adapter and the Power Tank.
customer_reviews.author: Wade Martin

customer_reviews.title: It was not easy process. It was exciting when I spotted Jupiter ...
customer_reviews.text: The motorized function stopped working after a few initial operation. Firmware upgrade solved the problem. It was not easy process. It was exciting when I spotted Jupiter and its 5 moons through the standard eyepiece that came with the telescope. Wow!
customer_reviews.author: Chang J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Amazed more as weeks pass on
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a basic refractor, every time I turn on my new Celestron NexStar 8 SE I feel like a kid ready to discover something new from my location. The scope's portability and neat image, specially with my new set of lenses and filters, also by Celestron, make a it nightly joy to gaze above. As weeks pass on, I am amazed more and more at observing the beautiful creation within our human reach.
customer_reviews.author: MiriamF de Valladares

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with the 8SE
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 'big' telescope. The last I had 2 decades ago was a 3 inch refractor, if I remember correctly. The Nexstar 8SE is the 'sweet-spot' scope for portability and image quality. The first time I tried SkyAlign (choose any 3 bright spots), it failed, but that's because I entered my location wrongly. After I redid it, wham! The GoTo works all the time; it really changes the way you find things to see in the sky. Highly recommended scope!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Yen

customer_reviews.title: Love the NexStar.
customer_reviews.text: very nice better then i expected. can see all the planets with clarity. might want to get the x-cel x3 Barlow with this one to get the most out of it. tracking is pretty good but need to have a level surface to make the best of it. a little kinks in the firmware maybe they fixed it already and just need to update it, but sometimes when get your two star alignment and press go to moon is spins the opposite way may be its just me not working it correctly. Over all love it cant stop using it.
customer_reviews.author: Van

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for planet and DSO that i tried: m42 m45 m57...
customer_reviews.author: Najeeb

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellant telescope and wish there were fewer street lights here
customer_reviews.author: John T. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Finally I have the telescope of my dreams! I ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally I have the telescope of my dreams! I have wanted one of these for decades and couldn't afford one. But the price and shipping were just right! I, unfortunately haven't been able to try it out yet because of the weather, but that won't last forever, and I will be up in the cosmos!!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Picture/view lacking and disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have as great of a view as the pictures and reviews said. The 400$ one I had, and returned thinking I was upgrading, had a better picture than this one. Was disappointed, had been so excited to see things from this product. Returned this one and will spend time researching options, then try again.
customer_reviews.author: MiknDar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent equipment
customer_reviews.text: Excellent equipment. Easy to install and use. It came as expected. I recommend to purchase with the power pack and the Celestron Accessory kit. If you install a web cam, you will really appreciate that the investment is worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando L Perez Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scope and Amazon, and it arrived a day early. No problem there. I found the scope to be easy to figure out. Aligning the three stars is pretty easy, especially since you don't have to know what they are. I have only used it in the city so far. I am looking forward to taking this out to the desert in a couple weeks. I will update my review after that. If you are casually interested in looking at the sky, this is a good quality solution.
customer_reviews.author: mtravis37

customer_reviews.title: Wishing for more ...
customer_reviews.text: Great scope ... I wish I had purchased Evolution for a little more. Do your research and evaluate which one is best for you.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Driscoll

customer_reviews.title: Celestron's NextStar 8 SE
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I should be reviewing it this soon, as there is definitely a learning curve involved. But, after a few sessions of stargazing, I believe the computer speed is about half of optimum. Either that, or a bigger text display is in order. I'm left waiting for the alignment message to be displayed, and waiting, and waiting. The tube optics are good, however the eyepiece FOV is limited. I replaced the eyepiece with one with a wider FOV and was able to align much easier. A Telrad will likely help the alignment, too. After all that, I still would recommend it and would buy it again if I had it to do over.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: It is not as easy as they make it sound
customer_reviews.text: So far 1 star. Cannot get the telescope to align. It is not as easy as they make it sound. No surprise really. Have done everything correctly. Also note that the controller buttons do not match the directions. If i get it aligned, I will update. UPDATE01/04/2016: I returned it to Amazon in original packing and got a prompt refund. Not sure why the telescope would not align. Checked and rechecked date, time, time zone, GPS coordinates, etc. I have used a non-computerized telescopes in the past.
customer_reviews.author: MF

customer_reviews.title: does what I want
customer_reviews.text: it is doing what was expected of it and it is very portable so I'm able to move about with it
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Like it but had to contact Celesteon for issue
customer_reviews.text: I like the telescope and I would have given it 5 stars except that I had problems with the SkyAlign process and had to contact Celestron who instructed me to reset to factory settings which fixed the issue.
customer_reviews.author: David Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Telescope!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Very well made. Works perfectly and the views are amazing. I have had other good telescopes thru the years but so far this is the best. Very easy to learn how to use it. The go to and tracking works very well. I have been able to find and observed objects from my backyard that I was not able to find star hopping before due to the amount of light pollution that exist where I live. Overall great product. I will recommend it to anyone interested in Star gazing and Astronomy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my father on sale as a Christmas present. The hand controller works, but is a bit of a pain to use sometimes. We use a laptop with Stellarium to control the scope instead. Overall a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Really nice telescope at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Brought this telescope to do a little moon watching, this thing is really nice and works really well. The tripod is good and sturdy and you can definitely move this thing around without too many issues.
customer_reviews.author: mezzoforty

customer_reviews.title: Obsolete electronics and software, RS-232 instead of USB on ...
customer_reviews.text: Obsolete electronics and software, RS-232 instead of USB on this days?, you must buy a converter, portable computers with serial ports are gone 10 year ago, why Celestron use that?;unfortunately this is only the first indication about the electronics and the software, the last one must be complete redone looks (and works) really outdated, the download page is a mess, Celestron must update the hardware/software/web page of this products.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic telescope
customer_reviews.text: The scope arrived the day I was told it would arrive. The container was intact with no visible damage. Every part was in the container. Assembly was simple. The scope is used every night - weather permitting - and some mornings. It literally exposed me to a new world, actually thousands of new worlds. Every time I use the scope, I learn something new; about the stars, or about the scope. My only regret is that I did not purchase the scope sooner.
customer_reviews.author: sticks

customer_reviews.title: Love the scope!
customer_reviews.text: Being a newbie to this field, I find this telescope surprisingly easy to use! Loving it so far. I took a few brilliant photos with it too!
customer_reviews.author: Rathi Banerjee

customer_reviews.title: whole new world(s)
customer_reviews.text: What a great purchase. Easy to set up and use. Immediately had Saturn in my view. The second star I looked at. I am still learning but that is half the fun. Can't wait for Comet ISON, the reason I bought this telescope to show up. The sky is the limit (or not).
customer_reviews.author: Randy Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent telescope for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent telescope for the price!! Haven't had much time to get it out because of weather conditions in my area, but was able to for a couple of hours one night. Was able to view jupiter and 4 of its moons with surprising detail. Got my best results with the 25mm lens and a 2x Barlow. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Martin Jennings

customer_reviews.title: While I have not set this up completely yet, ...
customer_reviews.text: While I have not set this up completely yet, or thus tried it out, I am extremely unhappy that the assembly documentation does not match the hardware. The tube is not assembled to the drive yet all the documentation shows that it is pre-assembled. For this amount of money I would think the documentation and hardware would be/should be in sync. WTF
customer_reviews.author: Scott Woods

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. I don't think I would need ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I don't think I would need anything larger.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Richardson

customer_reviews.title: This telescope is challenging at best to use
customer_reviews.text: I had a Celstron years ago without the computer finder. It was hard but easier that this one to use. I have tried a number of times to line this thing up perfectly with something besides the north star and it's a failure everttime. This telescope is challenging at best to use. AND all scopes should come with light pollution filters. These Schmidt cassegrain telescopes are getting better all the time but they're not there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Hitthespot

customer_reviews.title: I point the scope right on mars and it's just a really bright dot but when I zoom in the image just gets blurry and dull and a b
customer_reviews.text: Can some one help! I point the scope right on mars and it's just a really bright dot but when I zoom in the image just gets blurry and dull and a black circle starts to appear in it. This happens every time I try to zoom in on an object.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Will not work
customer_reviews.text: Have had problem from the beginning with no help, please help programing is not working,plus the finderscope is defective. Richard dupont
customer_reviews.author: j richard dupont

customer_reviews.title: Poor focus, very difficult to align - waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, we found the alignment very difficult. Spent more time trying to align it then actually looking through it. Unlike other reviewers, we were totally unimpressed with what we saw when we actually did get it to line up on something (manually - the software just plain didn't work well, and was way too cumbersome). Very fuzzy, difficult to see anything. The photos in the user's guide were amazing, but very misleading. You will not see anything like their adversing images using this telescope!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Mom x 3

customer_reviews.title: Tripod damaged upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: The Nexstar 8se seems like a great product but I have unfortunately not been able to use it. Upon arrival, one of the tripod legs showed a large crack over the length of the plastic frame connecting the upper and lower extensions of the leg.
customer_reviews.author: Garrison

customer_reviews.title: You are misslead
customer_reviews.text: Dear friend; With disappointment and after more than 10 times to do the set up and follow the manual instruction, this kind of telescope is more complicated than every body things. Even watching the tutorial videos, that looked easy it is not. I Strongly do not recommend to purchase this kind of telescope, you will end up frustrate Regards Willi
customer_reviews.author: Willi E. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is OK but I wouldn't buy this brand again
customer_reviews.author: Ron Ellis

product_meta.title: Celestron - NexStar 8SE Telescope - Computerized Telescope for Beginners and Advanced Users - Fully-Automated GoTo Mount - SkyAlign Technology - 40,000+ Celestial Objects - 8-Inch Primary Mirror
product_meta.description:
Style:NexStar 8SE Computerized Telescope| Configuration:Telescope Only

The best telescope is the one used often to enjoy the beauty and intrigue of the night sky. For those searching for telescopes for astronomy beginners that are infused with the latest computer technology, Celestron’s NexStar 8SE Schmidt-Cassegrain Telescope fits the bill perfectly. The NexStar 8SE Computerized Telescope features Celestron’s iconic “orange tube” design and updated technology with the latest features for amazing stargazing for beginners and experienced observers. Celestron’s signature telescope combines advanced features and excellent optics in one easy-to-use system, the NexStar 8SE. It’s the perfect choice for your first serious telescope, offering striking views at an economical price. 

The eight-inch primary mirror in this computerized telescope packs enough light-gathering ability to observe the best that our Solar System has to offer, from Saturn’s rings to the cloud bands on Jupiter and geographic features on the surface of the Moon. When it comes to deep sky objects, take your 8SE to a dark-sky site and you’ll see hundreds of pinpoint stars in the Hercules Globular Cluster, the spiral arms of the Whirlpool Galaxy, and more. Featuring a database of more than 40,000 celestial objects, the 8SE’s GoTo mount automatically locates and tracks objects for you. You can also take a Sky Tour and let your telescope show you the best objects currently visible. The single fork arm design and sturdy steel tripod all assemble and break down from separate components for easy transportation. SkyAlign technology gets your telescope aligned and ready to observe in minutes. Even if you’re unfamiliar with the night sky, you can easily align your telescope on any 3 bright objects. 

The NexStar 8SE is a telescope that will grow with you as you advance in the hobby of astronomy. It’s compatible with all the high-tech accessories advanced users love. Provide GPS coordinates to your telescope with SkySync, or add automatic alignment functionality with StarSense AutoAlign. 

Buy with confidence from the world’s #1 telescope brand, based in California since 1960. You’ll also receive a two-year warranty and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts. 



AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Review Celestron's Nexstar 8 SE telescope combines excellent optics and computerized "GoTo" tracking in a package that's light, portable and affordable. The legendary performance of Celestron's orange tube C8 telescope has been updated with high performance Starbright XLT coatings, and the single arm Nexstar mount now includes Celestron's easy to use "SkyAlign" technology. 

 

 The Nexstar 8 SE upholds Celestron's reputation for quality optics. When I use an 11mm Plossl eyepiece (almost 200x magnification) for example, I can easily see the Cassini Division in Saturn's rings. When I look at Jupiter, the pale orange color of Jupiter's famous Great Red Spot is visible, and I've even been able to identify the polar caps and spot dust storms on the planet Mars. A 20mm Plossl eyepiece (about 100x magnification) is a good choice for viewing galaxies and star clusters. When I look at globular cluster M13 in the constellation Hercules the high contrast XLT optics show me a glowing snowflake made of hundreds of tiny pin-point stars! And a low power 32mm Plossl eyepiece is a good choice for views of larger deep space highlights like the Andromeda Galaxy and the Orion Nebula. 

 

 Celestron's patented "SkyAlign" system makes the Nexstar 8 SE very easy to use. I just pick the nearest town from the built-in list, enter the date and time, and point the telescope at three bright stars. I don't need a star chart because "SkyAlign" identifies the stars for me. When I just want a quick look at the moon or a planet, I like to use the "Solar System Align" option. After entering the date and time, I just point the telescope at the moon and press the "Align" key. That's all it takes, the computer takes over and the telescope begins tracking quietly and accurately. At star parties I often have my Nexstar up and running while older computerized telescopes are still waiting for their alignment stars to appear in the twilight. 

 The Nexstar 8 SE comes with a simple red-dot finder scope and a basic 25mm eyepiece. You'll want to add a few good eyepieces to take full advantage of the Nexstar 8 SE's excellent optics. At the very least get Celestron's bargain priced Accessory Kit which includes high and low power plossl eyepieces, or treat yourself to some top rated Tele Vue eyepieces. At twenty-four pounds total weight, the Nexstar 8 SE is unusually light and portable for an eight-inch telescope. The drawback of course is that some people will find it too light. Like other Schmidt Cassegrain (SCT) telescopes there are plenty of optional accessories to upgrade this telescope with, such as heavy duty tripods and an optical finder scope. If you want to try astro-photography, however, check out Celestron's CPC 800 Telescope which features a heavy duty mount and tripod and an 8x50 optical finder scope right out of the box. --Jeff Phillips 

 Pros: 

 * Excellent optics 
 * Easy computerized GoTo tracking 
 * Light, portable and affordable 

Cons:  * Plastic accessories 
 * Short battery life 
 * Too light for astro-photography 



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Manufacturer Description
The largest of the NexStar SE family with 78% more light gathering than a 6-inch model, the NexStar 8 SE will enable you to see deep into the Universe. The distinctive patented fork arm with ergonomically designed integrated hand control cradle gives solid support to Celestron's classic 8-inch optics. The NexStar 8 SE features Schmidt-Cassegrain 8-inch aperture optics with our premium StarBright XLT coatings and a powerful 2,032mm focal length and f10 focal ratio. 

 About the NexStar SE Series: 



 NexStar 8 SE Features:
The NexStar 8 SE has all the same features as Celestron's most advanced computerized GoTo telescopes, including our revolutionary SkyAlign alignment technology, a sky tour feature, a database of over 40,000 celestial objects, and easy-to-use hand control. 

 Plug the optional CN-16 GPS accessory into NexStar's auxiliary port and download data from orbiting GPS satellites for truly quick and easy alignments. The universe may be full of mysteries, but using the NexStar 8 SE isn't one of them. 

 In the tradition of Celestron's famous orange optical tubes, the NexStar SE Family combines the classic heritage of the original orange tube telescopes with state-of-the-art features including a fully computerized operating system, flash upgradeable hand control, our superior StarBright XLT coatings, our revolutionary SkyAlign telescope alignment software, and much more. 

 Whether you are a seasoned astronomer looking for a portable scope with advanced features, or just starting your astronomy adventure and looking for an easy way to enjoy the night sky, a NexStar SE will help you take a closer look. 

 Every NexStar SE includes a version of The Sky software Level 1 Planetarium software for exploring the Universe on your PC and printing out custom star charts of the sky. In addition, you receive our NexRemote software that allows you to operate your telescope via your PC. This software package, valued at over $100, is included free with your NexStar SE! 

 General Features:


 * 8-inch Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope 
 * SE combines the classic heritage of the original orange tube telescopes with the latest state-of-the-art features 
 * StarBright XLT high transmission coatings come standard 
 * Quick release fork arm mount, optical tube, and accessory tray for no-tool setup 
 * Celestron's unique patented single fork arm with integral hand control design provides a rigid and smooth operating structure for the optical tube 
 * StarPointer finderscope to help with alignment and accurately locating objects 
 * Sturdy computerized altazimuth mount 
 * Ultra sturdy steel tripod with accessory tray 
 * Star diagonal provides more comfortable viewing position when observing objects that are high in the sky 

 Computerized Features:


 * Proven NexStar computer control technology 
 * 40,000 object database with 200 user-definable objects and expanded information on over 200 objects 
 * SkyAlign allows you to align on any three bright celestial objects, making for a fast and easy alignment process 
 * Flash upgradeable hand control software and motor control units for downloading product updates over the Internet 
 * Custom database lists of all the most famous deep-sky objects by name and catalog number; the most beautiful double, triple, and quadruple stars; variable star; solar systems; objects and asterisms 
 * DC Servo motors with encoders on both axes 
 * Autoguider port for long exposure astrophotography 
 * Double line, 16-character liquid crystal display hand control with backlit LED buttons for easy operation of go-to features 
 * NexRemote telescope control software and RS-232 cable included for advanced control of your telescope via computer 
 * GPS-compatible with optional CN16 GPS accessory (93963) 



See more
feature_bullets: NEXSTAR COMPUTERIZED TELESCOPE: The NexStar 8SE Computerized Telescope features Celestron’s iconic orange tube design with updated technology and the latest features for amazing stargazing for beginners and experienced observers.

8-INCH APERTURE: The eight-inch primary mirror in this Schmidt-Cassegrain telescope for adults and kids to be used together packs enough light-gathering ability to observe the best that our Solar System has to offer, while retaining a compact form factor. Compatible with starsense technology, Wifi

FULLY-AUTOMATED GOTO MOUNT: Featuring a database of more than 40,000 celestial objects, the GoTo mount built into our telescopes for astronomy beginners automatically locates and tracks objects for you.

EASY TO ASSEMBLE AND BREAK DOWN: The single fork arm design and sturdy steel tripod all assemble and break down from separate components for easy transportation. SkyAlign technology gets your telescope aligned and ready in minutes.
BONUS FREE STARRY NIGHT SOFTWARE: The NexStar 8SE Telescope includes a FREE download of one of the top consumer rated astronomy software programs for an interactive sky simulation.

UNBEATABLE WARRANTY AND CUSTOMER SUPPORT: Buy with confidence from the world’s #1 telescope brand, based in California since 1960. You’ll also receive a two-year warranty and unlimited access to technical support from our team of US-based experts.
